input_text:
Job Title: Database Architect

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Title: Database Architect Job Type: Full Time Location: Alpharetta, GA or Northbrook, ILWork Model: HybridReports To: VP of IT 
Company Overview: Our client is a dynamic technology-driven distributor in the Promotional Products Industry. With a focus on Fortune 1000 firms, they specialize in turnkey solutions that allow clients to outsource their promotional products initiatives while maintaining control and visibility through seamless integration with back-office systems. 
About the Client: Our client operates at the intersection of technology and creativity. Their main offices are located in Northbrook, IL, and Alpharetta, GA. As a team of 135 dedicated professionals, they work collaboratively to provide highly customized and connected technical solutions. Their expertise lies in integrating front-end web stores with suppliers, clients, and their own SAP back-office systems. 
Role Summary: As a Database Architect, you will play a crucial role in our ongoing transition. Due to a recent merger, we now manage two distinct front-end web store systems, each integrated with a different ERP. Our goal is to gradually phase out one ERP in favor of the more robust SAP system. Your responsibilities will include capturing essential information from our systems, establishing data governance, and ensuring accurate and valuable reporting. 
Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with senior architects to streamline data flows between web stores and SAP for billing, inventory management, and shipping. Assist in creating and maintaining data governance policies to ensure data accuracy and consistency. Work closely with the IT team during client implementations, providing support for reporting and system enhancements. Be proactive in identifying opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains. Adapt to changing client requirements and contribute to metric-based decision making. 
Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.Basic understanding of database design principles and SQL. Strong analytical skills and mindfulness.Eagerness to learn and grow within a dynamic team environment. 
Why Join The Team? Our client values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. As a member of the team, you will have the opportunity to contribute directly to their success. The client encourages creativity, celebrates diversity, and fosters a supportive work culture. Join them as they move forward with momentum, serving their clients with excellence and integrity.

Experience Level (if available): None
